page.title: 08The King's Head Ghost.
page.content: On the hill opposite the church stands the King's Head public house which it is thought stands on part of the 14th century churchyard. Forming part of one wall of the pub are two ancient grave stones.A number of years ago one of the gravestones was moved and that started the haunting. Moans and footsteps were heard in the main bar and weird noises came from one of the guest rooms upstairs which neither the landlord's cat nor dog would go into. The gravesstone was eventully replaced in its original position but the ghostly phenomenon still continues There is said to be another ghost in the area which haunts Loddenden Manor by the old school.
